text: hi everyone it's Allen here today I will
be cooking a pretty smelly dessert it's
called social ring in Vietnamese it's
actually stick to rice cooked with a
very exalted Asian fruit called
durian I first try this sticky rice when
I visited the Bantam market in Saigon
it's a large market place a tourist
attraction and the symbol of the city
during the day you can find almost
anything there from local textile
grocery meat seafood and souvenirs
it is quiet touristy place and the price
is pretty high compared to other markets
so make sure you bug and well to the
left and the right open time market are
two small streets where you can
experience the strict lifestyle in
Vietnam
there's many interesting street food
scene is happening and you can always
grab a stool and sit down and enjoy the
delicious food the market itself is
closed at night but at exactly 6:00 p.m.
on the streets
right beside it local stores start
setting up their food carts and local
handicrafts and souvenirs it's a good
place for foreigners to hang out and try
the local food and the food cars that
catch my attention every time are the
ones that sell a variety of colorful
icky rice each type has a different
color and flavor it is made from a
different ingredient that has that color
and today I will make the yellow sticky
rice with durian for those who can smell
it durian smells horrible but for those
who love it you definitely have to give
this recipe a try let's begin recipe
firstly wash 2 cups or 400 grams of
sticky rice and soak in water for at
least 1 hour or until it doubles in
volume add some salt and a few drops of
yellow food coloring or durian extract
you can buy this durian extract at Asian
market it will give the cook sticky rice
a nice yellow color you also need 1 pack
of coconut cream powder 60 gram mix in
with the rice and toss well durian is a
large spiky fruit with distinctive odor
the edible part is the yellow flash
inside the husk you can check out the
flash from fresh durian or buy it frozen
like this as asian store for this recipe
I use half a power or 230 gram place the
yellow flash in a bowl add 3 to 4 tbsp
of sugar depending on the sweetness of
the durian mix well and mash the durian
into a creamy paste you can use any kind
of steamer that you have today I use
this collapsible steaming basket view a
large pot with 1 to 2 inches of water
place the steamer basket into it making
sure that the base is higher than the
water level lie the steamer basket with
a piece of banana leaf or a plasma paper
and transfer the sticky rice onto it
make a random holes on the rice so the
steam can come up and cook the rice
evenly cover and steam for about 20 to
25 minutes until the
turns quite translucent you have sticks
to fluff the rice and have a taste is
soft and could be a little dry but
that's okay just add the durian paste
and stir well saving a little bit for
garnish later the durian paste gonna
moisten the rice and make it more
glutinous that's also the reason why I
use coconut cream powder instead of
coconut milk if you use coconut milk the
sticky rice will be too soggy compress
the sticky rice in whatever mode that
you have handle move it onto a plate add
some of the reserved durian paste on top
add some shredded young coconut and
roast sesame on top to garnish and you
are done let's have a try the Sakura I
should be soft and glutinous is moist
but not too mushy is slightly sweet and
has a perfect smell up durian and
coconut mmm it's tastes really good
just like the delicious food as you
prepare and put on Instagram Facebook
and Google+ with hashtag helen recipes
oh and this was what the lady was
selling our seventh and market at the
beginning of the video and I'm so glad
that quite a few of you have a succeeded
with the sesame balls recipe but for
those who fails you can still send me
the photos of the failed product maybe I
can give you some advice if you want to
try out more Vietnamese dishes that
smell like hell tastes like heaven just
click here and don't forget to subscribe
to my channel for more delicious
Vietnamese food
thank you for watching bye-bye
you
